contentrichtext.text: '''Zacapú''' (''Place of Stones''), is a city and surrounding [[municipalities of Mexico|municipality]] in the [[Nahuatzen mountains]]<ref>{{cite web|title=Zacapú|url=http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/655245/Zacapu|work=Encyclopædia Britannica|publisher=Encyclopædia Britannica, Inc.|accessdate=4 June 2012}}</ref> of [[Michoacán, Mexico]]. It is located at {{coord|19|49|N|101|48|W|}}. The municipality has an area of 455.96km<sup>2</sup> (176.05 sq mi). Geographic features in Zacapu include the [[Cerro del Tecolote]] mountain range. == Demographics == The 2010 Mexican census indicated that the city had a population of 52,806 and the municipality a population of 73,455.<ref>{{cite web|title=Marco Geoestadistico Nacional|url=http://www.inegi.org.mx/geo/contenidos/geoestadistica/catalogoclaves.aspx|work=INEGI: Instituto Nacional de Estadística, Geografía e Informática|publisher=INEGI: Instituto Nacional de Estadística, Geografía e Informática|accessdate=4 June 2012|language=Spanish}}</ref> ==Notable people== * [[José Ángel Aguilar]] - Writer. * [[Juan B. Guido]] - Poet. * [[Jacob the Dacian|Fray Jacobo Daciano]] - Danish [[Franciscan order|Franciscan priest]], member of the Tzintzuntzan convent. * [[Primo Tapia de la Cruz]] - Labor leader who organized farming communities against landholders. He was assassinated in 1926. * [[Abel Alcázar Pallares]] - Philanthropist and community activist. * [[Armando Martínes "Amando Martínez"]] - Ciclist. * [[Rodolfo Vitela "El Quijote" ]] - Ciclist * [[Jorge del Pozzo]] - Businessman * [[César Martínez (Mexican boxer)|César Martínez]] - Boxer. * [[Adolfo García Trujillo]] - Marathonist. * [[Eugenio Calderón]] - Professional footballer, played for [[Cruz Azul]], Morelia, Irapuato, Tigres and Guadalajara. Retired in 1992. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.e-local.gob.mx/wb2/ELOCAL/EMM_michoacan Michoacán], Enciclopedia de los Municipios de México *[http://zacapu.com/ Zacapu.com], website from Zacapu city (in Spanish) *[http://zacapu.gob.mx/ Zacapu.gob.mx], Zacapu municipal government website (in Spanish) {{Michoacán}} [[Category:Municipalities of Michoacán]] [[Category:Populated places in Michoacán]] {{Michoacán-geo-stub}}
